title: What is happening when the dvd player cannot read the disc? - Quora

response.answer_text: Any number of things: The disc is damagedThe disc is scratchedThe disc is the wrong formatThe data on the disc is the wrong formatThe data on the disc is damaged or corruptedThe player's spindle isn't spinningThe player's spindle isn't spinning properlyThe laser isn't workingThe laser isn't focusingThe laser is out of alignmentAn internal connection has failedSome other internal component has failedProbably a couple dozen more things I can't think of right nowTroubleshooting such a thing over the internet is hit-and-miss at the best of times.  Troubleshooting it over the internet with the complete dearth of information you've provided is impossible.

There are multiple reasons for this to happen No 1. Disc damage This is easy to test, put another disc on your DVD player or play this disc on another player DVD player or on a PC with DVD drive. If it’s the problem of the disc, then it might be it’s damaged or it’s not properly burned. For a damaged disc, there is not much you can do. But if it’s not properly burned, you can try burn your disc again according to this mp4 to DVD tutorial and try play it again. No 2. Player glitch If it’s not the disc, then it’s most likely that your DVD player is broken. In this case, you have to either fix what’s wrong, or convert your DVD or convert blu-ray to mp4with some ripping program to just watch it on your PC. No 3. Display problem If you can hear the sound but not see the picture, consider there might be something wrong with your display. These are the most likely reasons for your DVD not playing disc.
